result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D Tweedie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
REPORT TO PROBATION ON 8/17/15 BY NOON.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 14CF806.

miscConds.notes:
Complete High School Diploma and obtain employment.
.

Within 60 days, def to undergo Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with the co-actors in this incident.

No contact with Robert B. except a letter of apology given to PO and delivered to the District Attorneys office.
.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.
.

supervisions.notes:
Unpaid Court costs/fees are converted to a civil judgment
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas D Tweedie

records.addlTxt: Revoked- sentenced to CJ

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing After Revocation held 6-18-17 w/ TWB - filed by Tina Bjerke

3:44 pm Def in court w/ Atty Patricia Linda O'Neil.  Def in custody.  Noel A Lawrence appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The victim rights act has been complied.  Victim comments.  Lawrence comments and leaves the sentence to the Court.  O'Neil comments and asks for credit on the initial confinement part.  Tweedie comments.  Court comments.
SENTENCES:
15CF-240 - 4 mos CJ w/4 mos credit - CC converted to a CV judgment
15CF-143 - 1 year CJ w/270 days credit - CC converted to a CV justment
14CF-806 - 6 years prison 
1 year Initial confinement w/333 days credit - consecutive to 15CF-143 first and then 15CF-240
5 years extended supervision
Conditions:
Live with the Clemersons'
Curfew from 9 pm to 6 am - PO can adjust that as they see fit
No alcohol or controlled substances w/o Rx from a Dr.
Random testing
CC and Restitution if any
He is eligible for CIP or ERP
DOC Balance Inquiry

Patricia O'Neil
Nikki Swayne
from JSS re: Defendant's UA results from 07-31-15 came back clean.

CRT: Sentence withheld 3 years probation concurrent w/14CF806 w/ cond: no contact with/co-actors in this incident, no contact w/RB except a letter of apology given to PO & delivered to the DA office, undergo any psychological eval & comply within 60 days, complete HS diploma & obtain employment, no alcohol or CS w/random testing, if all terms met will consider early termination, pay CC + DOC Supervision fees, 973.015 upon successful completion of probation
Def to report to Probation on 8/17/15 by noon. Court moved this sentence up to have things taken care of & probation not open today. Any questiond - DOC can contact TWB

From: JSS Re: court req UA on 7/31 prior to court, would not have results until 8/3 or 4, would court like UA done on 29th so can have results for hearing?
TWB: 31st before court is fine. Report results to me following week

Def in custody w/atty Bolles by phone
CRT: modify bond to $2500 sig bond w/cond: GPS - house arrest, Mr & Mrs C can call JS if they need to take you some place, no contact w/NH, DW & RB, no alcohol or CS, sign on test when you come in Friday
SEH: 7/31 @ 2:30

From: Atty Bolles Re: bond conditions

ADA Hynek: because of poor performance & potential prison - ask to not approve def's release
TWB: set for hearing

Set CC 4 wks

From: JSS Re: response to ADA Hyneks letter
EML: file
COMPAS

State by Hilton / Def in custody w/ Atty David Bolles by phone
Bolles:  Def in custody for 30 days as of today, unable to post cash bond.  Def would like opportunity to show he can be in community - has education set up thru Job Corp, prgram for training & employment - has appt lined up.  Has job that will accept him back...
CRT:  does he live in MN?
Bolles:  yes - if CRT allows out on bond, would like to go back to Logan HS & would live in Caledonia...Job Corp program is in MKE
Def comments - currently registered in MKE program...
State addresses COMPAS scores
CRT receives & reviews copy of COMPAS evaluation
CRT:  $2500 Sig bond allowed (covers both 14CF806 & 15CF143) w/ conditions:  GPS for House Arrest @ Caledonia address;  Release to do Job Search & for employment;  No Contact w/ Nathan H., Demetrius W. & Robert B.;  No alcohol;  No drugs or cont subs w/o valid prescription;  If issue changes w/ Job Corp - write a letter to CRT to modify bond if approp at that time;  Def is given permission to go to Logan HS to clear up book issue
CRT lifts the No Contact w/ La Crosse Co
Def to go to JSS to get set up w/ GPS - def to keep monitor charged.  How things go w/ House Arrest will be huge indicator for CRT.  
STC:  4-30-15 @ 10am

Sanford argues for sig bond.  Hynek:  He's already been on conditions he hasn't abided by...  Thinks cash is appropriate.
COURT:  It appears that the bond that was set is on the lower end...  Bond to remain.  Referred to JS for a compass evaluation.
David Bolles
